thread.title: H.S. football roundup: Mahwah, Fort Lee, Tenafly roll to wins - Sports
thread.title_full: H.S. football roundup: Mahwah, Fort Lee, Tenafly roll to wins - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: FROM STAFF REPORTS |
title: H.S. football roundup: Mahwah, Fort Lee, Tenafly roll to wins - Sports
text:
James Ciliento ran for two touchdowns and passed for another, and Zayjay Colon-Carrero rushed for 126 yards and two TDs on 21 carries to power Mahwah over Ramsey, 35-0, in a Big North football game Friday night at Ramsey.
Jack Hope led the Mahwah (5-0) defense with 10 tackles and a fumble recovery against the Rams (3-2).
FORT LEE 33, DWIGHT MORROW 26 (at Englewood) — Jason Samuel-Olagunju scored on a 67-yard run with two minutes remaining to lift the Bridgemen (1-4) over the Maroon Raiders (1-4). Samuel-Olagunju finished with 267 yards on 18 carries as Fort Lee snapped a six-game losing streak.
TENAFLY 37, NORTHERN HIGHLANDS 36 (at Tenafly) — Brett Waller had 125 yards and three touchdowns on 10 rushes, and caught a 65-yard TD pass as the Tigers (2-3) edged the Highlanders (2-3). Jordan Abisror returned a blocked punt 15 yards for a Tenafly score.
Noah Abdalla threw three touchdown passes, two to C.J. Bennewitz, and Gavin Quarto had a 60-yard punt return TD for Northern Highlands.
WAYNE VALLEY 44, TEANECK 20 (at Wayne) — Grant Ferrauilo completed 7 of 8 passes for 103 yards and three touchdowns to lead the Indians (5-0). Will Kearney had 60 yards and a touchdown on nine carries, and added four tackles and a sack for Wayne Valley.
Jordan Gamble caught a 58-yard TD pass from Jamaal Carr and threw a 25-yard scoring strike to Cory Gordon for the Highwaymen (0-5).
RIVER DELL 36, WESTWOOD 7 (at Washington Township) — Dylan Connolly ran for more than 100 yards and two touchdowns, and threw an 82 yard-TD pass to David Estevez as the Golden Hawks (6-0) topped the Cardinals (2-4).
Estevez tossed a 44-yard touchdown pass to Matt Coppola, intercepted a pass and forced a fumble.
NJIC 
GLEN ROCK 6, NEW MILFORD 0 (at Glen Rock) — Matt Schlett’s 1-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter was the lone score of the Panthers’ (4-1) first night game at home.
The Knights (2-3) dropped their third straight game.
HASBROUCK HEIGHTS 35, SECAUCUS 6 (at Hasbrouck Heights) — Brian Moran scored on runs of 1 and 40 yards, and James Pikowski had touchdown rushes of 35 and 8 yards to lift the Aviators (4-1).
Evander Pons ran for a 5-yard TD for the Patriots (0-5).
PALISADES PARK/LEONIA 40, ELMWOOD PARK 6 (at Palisades Park) — Jojo Robinson carried 10 times for 160 yards and three touchdowns, threw a 28-yard TD pass and returned an interception 88 yards for a score to power the Tigers (2-3) over the Crusaders (0-5). Marcus Marson had 94 yard and a touchdown on 11 rushes, and hauled in Robinson’s TD strike.
Phil Walsh had two sacks for Palisades Park/Leonia.
SADDLE BROOK 42, EMERSON 7 (at Emerson) — Andrew Camilleri returned an interception 19 yards for a touchdown and ran for a 1-yard score to power the Falcons (4-1). Ryan Lortz caught five passes for 71 yards and a TD, and Joe Ferri had a 60-yard touchdown run.
Frank Manning scored on a 4-yard rush for the Cavos (0-5).
NJAC 
PEQUANNOCK 35, HOPATCONG 13 (at Hopatcong) — Justin Brunda had touchdown runs of 3, 30 and 2 yards to lead the Golden Panthers (4-1) over the Chiefs (2-3). Tommy Crooks scored on rushes of 1 and 40 yards for Pequannock.
